Transcription for 547098

Living in a world so full of life,
Living in a world so full of life,
Living in a world so full of life,
Living in a world so simple,
Tis thy cross, bestrave the being,
Thousand thrones may assail thee,
Let thy thoughts of the inner find.
Under darkness, pain and sorrow,
Till the light that he then tried.
I would yet see, on my bedside,
How the clouds see through the mead,
Christ the Father, and the best Lord,
Thine own eye, the will of thee.
Living on, now you are the joy,
Thine own eye, the will of thee.
Of the Father, may the divine
Light the roads on which the road.
Of the Father, may the divine
Light the roads on which the road.
So with royal power we hold,
Take him on with the road.
I love my Son, I'll with my being,
God the Lord, God the Son.
God the Lord, God the Father,
God the Lord, Son with the Lord.
